meta.description: Educational content regarding loan processes, fees, and safety guidelines for Indian borrowers.

fee_decoder.title: The Real Cost of Your Loan
fee_decoder.description: Beyond interest, these are the charges you need to budget for.

charges.name: Login / Application Fee
charges.payable_when: At the time of submitting application
charges.insight: This covers initial admin costs. Demand a receipt immediately. Usually non-refundable even if the loan is rejected.

charges.name: Processing Fee (PF)
charges.payable_when: Deducted from loan disbursement or paid via cheque
charges.insight: Highly Negotiable! Ask for a 50% waiver, especially during festive offers. Never pay this in cash to an agent.

charges.name: Legal & Valuation Charges
charges.insight: Paid to 3rd party lawyers and engineers to verify property title and value. Ask if this is included in the Processing Fee.

charges.name: Franking / Stamp Duty
charges.insight: A state government tax on the loan contract execution. This is mandatory and receipts must be preserved.

charges.name: MODT / MOE Charges
charges.full_name: Memorandum of Deposit of Title / Memorandum of Entry
charges.payable_when: At the time of loan registration
charges.insight: The fee to register the bank's lien (claim) on your property with the government sub-registrar.

charges.name: CERSAI Charge
charges.payable_when: With first EMI or Processing Fee
charges.insight: A central registry fee to prevent fraud (ensuring the same property isn't mortgaged to two banks). Mandatory.

safety_protocol.title: Fraud Prevention Protocol
safety_protocol.description: Follow these rules to avoid agent scams.

checklist.explanation: Processing fees, login fees, or 'verification charges' should never be paid in cash to an agent.
Cheques/DDs must be payable to 'Bank Name - Loan Account' (e.g., 'HDFC Bank Ltd'). Never issue cheques to an individual's name.
If an agent asks for a personal commission to 'guarantee' approval, it is a scam. Loan approvals are centralized and system-driven.
Every payment must have a printed receipt with a Transaction ID/Application Number.

common.note: PAN, Aadhaar (Address must match residence or provide Rent Agreement)
Usually 2-4 copies signed across the face
Keep one cheque ready favoring the lender

salaried.note: Last 6 months (Salary account). Ensure no cheque bounces.

self_employed.note: Last 2-3 years with computation of income
GST Registration / Shop Act License (min 3 years vintage)

property_documents.note: Draft or Registered agreement with builder/seller
Chain of ownership for past 13-30 years

clauses.red_flag: Any value > 0% for Floating Rate Home Loans
clauses.norm: RBI Mandate: ZERO penalty for floating rate loans taken by individuals. (Fixed rate loans may have 2-4% penalty).
clauses.action: Ensure the clause explicitly says 'NIL for floating rate'.

clauses.red_flag: Clause allowing bank to change 'Spread' arbitrarily
clauses.norm: Your rate = Repo Rate + Spread. The 'Spread' should remain constant for the loan tenure. Only Repo Rate should change.
clauses.action: Ask agent: 'Is the Spread fixed for the entire tenure?'

clauses.norm: Loan Insurance (Credi-Shield etc.) is OPTIONAL per RBI. Property Insurance is mandatory.
clauses.action: You can reject this and use your existing Term Insurance. It is usually 5x cheaper.

clauses.norm: Penalty for missed EMIs is typically 2% per month (24% p.a.) on the overdue amount.
clauses.action: Be aware of this high cost of bouncing a cheque.

agent_script.title: Questions to Ask the Agent
questions: Is the Loan Insurance mandatory? Please show me the RBI circular that says so.
Is my interest rate linked to Repo Rate (RLLR) or MCLR?
What is the exact foreclosure charge if I pay from my own savings?
Is the 'Spread' fixed for the entire tenure?
Can you waive 50% of the processing fee?
